The principles, indications and main complications of a general anaesthetic are presented in figure 3 (''''''''''''''''''''''''[[Preoperative explanation and collection of consent for an invasive diagnostic or therapeutic procedure SD-239|preoperative explanation and collection of consent for an invasive diagnostic or therapeutic procedure]]''''''').
[[File:Figure 4. Mechanism of action of curares..jpg|thumb|'''Figure 4. Mechanism of action of curares.''']]]
The mechanism of action of curares is shown in Figure 4.

question.title: What is the primary mechanism of action of curares in general anaesthesia?
question.description: The mechanism of action of curares in general anaesthesia

option_a.title: Blocking the release of acetylcholine
option_a.description: Blocking the release of acetylcholine at the neuromuscular junction

option_b.title: Increasing the concentration of acetylcholine
option_b.description: Increasing the concentration of acetylcholine at the neuromuscular junction

option_c.title: Activating the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor
option_c.description: Activating the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor at the neuromuscular junction

option_d.title: Inhibiting the action of acetylcholinesterase
option_d.description: Inhibiting the action of acetylcholinesterase, the enzyme that breaks down acetylcholine

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
